philosophy: I believe in practical, hands-on learning that bridges the gap between theoretical knowledge and real-world application. Having transitioned from Electronics Engineering to Software Development myself, I understand the challenges of learning new technologies. My training sessions focus on building problem-solving skills through live coding, real-world projects, and interactive discussions. I emphasize understanding the 'why' behind every piece of code â€” because a developer who understands principles can adapt to any technology.

experiences.description: Led Pakistan's first-ever free IT bootcamp as Java/Spring Lead Trainer. Designed comprehensive curriculum covering Core Java, Spring Boot, REST APIs, and database integration. Delivered classroom instruction, provided one-on-one coaching, and evaluated student progress. Trained unemployed and underemployed graduates to launch careers in software development.

Contributed to CodeGirls' mission of empowering women through vocational IT training and bridging the gender gap in tech. Delivered hands-on training on backend development, APIs, and practical coding practices. Guided students through real-world projects, best practices, and debugging techniques. Mentored participants to improve problem-solving, teamwork, and coding confidence as part of a social responsibility initiative to empower future tech talent.

He had a unique way of leading the class and taking every single person as a single target to teach, which was a required attitude for a teacher.
